title: P-8A / P-3C Acoustic Operator / Instructor / NATOPS Evaluator for Operational Test and Evaluation.
name: Christopher Kurylowicz

groups.name: ClearedJobs.Net - Active Security Clearance required - for Cleared Professionals

description: P-8A / P-3C Acoustic Operator / Instructor / NATOPS Evaluator for Operational Test and Evaluation Operations / Schedules Acting LCPO (Front Line Manager) / LPO (Front Line Leader) Classified Network Administrator and Database Manager •P-8A Acoustics Subject Matter Expert (SME) providing operational test and evaluation data on 116 issues from over 270 hours of P-8A Flight Test, over 350 hours of P-8A Weapons System Integration Lab testing, and 111 hours of P-8A Ground Test. •Designed and submitted to engineers, an improved P-8A acoustic software display that optimizes the observable bandwidth, increases capability for analysis, classification, and probability of detection, while requiring minimal coding to produce, and zero additional signal processing by the system. •Created and implemented an accelerated training plan resulting in over 20 P-3C aircrew and Fleet Integration Team (FIT) instructors (Train the Trainers) being qualified in the P-8A, while increasing the manning available for operational test and development. •Assigned as a network administrator for a portable Closed Loop Local Area Network (CLAN) consisting of 12 machines accredited for processing at the classified level of Secret and proven to be an invaluable asset for post mission analysis in support of the operational test and evaluation of the US Navy’s P-8A Poseidon. •Identified inefficiencies in the organization’s database, and implemented a process improvement to automate daily, monthly, and annual reports, which reduced man-hours by up to 50%. •As the Operations LPO (Front Line Leader) and acting LCPO (Front Line Manager), supervised 10 personnel in the creation of 24 weekly and 144 daily flight schedules, including 473 flight and 442 ground events, totaling 805 flight hours on 11 different types of aircraft. Conducted weekly planning boards for evaluation, monthly flight order audit boards, and supervised the upkeep of flight log books for 96 personnel.

title: P-3C Acoustic Operator / Instructor / NATOPS Evaluator
name: Christopher Kurylowicz

groups.name: ClearedJobs.Net - Active Security Clearance required - for Cleared Professionals

description: P-3C Acoustic Operator / Instructor / NATOPS Evaluator Airborne Acoustic Intelligence (AAI) Operator Electro-Optics / Infra-Red (EO/IR) Operator In-Flight Photographer CRM Facilitator NATOPS LPO (Front Line Leader) Professional Development LPO (Front Line Leader) Mentor •Recipient of the 2006 Captain Getzfred, P-3C Sensor Station One Operator of the Year. •Out of a total of 12 P-3C aircrews, recorded more than 60% of the organization’s acoustic sub surface contact time during a 6 month deployment to Japan. •Skilled in using various intelligence products with the operation of multiple EO/IR platforms to locate, image, and report on targets of interest. •Command NATOPS LPO (Front Line Leader) supervising four track managers responsible for training, testing, evaluating, and maintaining flight records for over 150 officer and enlisted aircrew. Successfully lead the department through 4 Fleet NATOPS Evaluation Team (FNET) inspections, keeping the squadron in full compliance with aircrew training and safety directives. •Conducted 48 NATOPS evaluations and provided Crew Resource Management (CRM) training, while maintaining 32 NATOPS flight records, and producing over 20 open and closed book exams, which enabled the organization to maintain 12 qualified aircrews during a tri-site deployment while operating out of 11 different locations. •Identified deficiencies and improved the organization’s acoustic training program to ensure operator knowledge met or exceeded the standard. •Supervised and coordinated the training for the entire organization of 170 personnel in the areas of Leadership Development, General Military Training (GMT), Command Indoctrination, Low Pressure Night Vision, Instrument Ground School, Instrument Checks, Weapons Qualifications, Government Vehicle Licensing, and Joint Services Training Program.

title: AW 'A' School Classroom Instructor / Evaluator
name: Christopher Kurylowicz

groups.name: ClearedJobs.Net - Active Security Clearance required - for Cleared Professionals

description: Classroom Instructor / Evaluator Network Administrator Red Cross Emergency Shelter Manager Disaster Recovery Coordinator Base Axillary Security Force (ASF) •Achieved a graduation rate of over 90% through classroom instruction of over 800 students in the subjects of Acoustic Oceanography, Basic Acoustics, Basic Radar and Naval History. •Identified a more efficient use of computerized classroom equipment by converting over 2000 pages of classified paper based training curriculum to digital format, while implementing network security policies and providing the training for instructors to control access. This resulted in a 70% reduction in recurring print costs saving $50,000 annually. •Terminal Area Security Officer (TASO) / Network Administrator for over 250 computers on 10 separate Closed loop Local Area Networks (CLAN) classified to the level of Secret. •In the aftermath of hurricane Ivan, managed the disassembly and transfer of 10 electronic classrooms, consisting of over 250 classified systems, and 1812 pieces of classified material to an alternate facility. Then, created 4 temporary classified electronic classrooms to allow the continuation of training, all in a period of only 4 days. •Supervised a team of 8 contractors in a post hurricane rebuilding and configuring of the organization’s 10 electronic classrooms, including electrical wiring, network wiring, and integration of audio and visual systems. Then, designed a plan, and managed 14 teams of over 150 personnel to move 250 workstations and over 1800 pieces of classified material from a temporary training facility, all resulting in zero lost training days.

description: P-3C Acoustic Operator / Instructor CNO Special Projects Beartrap Operator / Instructor Tactical Proficiency Course (TPS) Instructor Division Acoustic Training PO Barracks Security Command Brig Escort Computer Technician •Used calibrated recording systems, advanced detection and tracking systems, special sensors, advanced processing systems and techniques, and specially derived operational tactics to provide acoustic data on submarines for the purpose of measuring Sound Pressure Levels (SPL) and increasing US Navy’s ASW effectiveness. •Skilled in using various intelligence products with the operation of multiple EO/IR platforms to locate, image, and report on targets of interest. •Demonstrated the value of digital photography in maritime patrol and became the first P-3C aircrewman to deliver photographic intelligence of a high value target to military leaders within hours of landing. Digital cameras became the standard for P-3C aircrews 18 months later.
